Content: also, in case it helps, for a fixed AC name FOOAC, the p2p and rpc ports generated by default will always be the same, i.e. deterministic

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jorian @grewalsatinder i saw one/both of you talking about parsing .conf files to get rpc user/pass details

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: something to take note, there are many bugs, some still in btc core today, about special chars in password field

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: such as `#` in password

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and things that need to be escaped in a URL often cause bugs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: also `=` in a password. some things to test for and be aware of 😃

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
glad to know.. 🙂 
I'm just gonna start with basic and later come back to perfect this thing.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: it works and I can move to api stuff now

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: don't just split on `=` in a .conf file

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that will fail on a = inside a pw

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i have run into that exact bug

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: so what should be the condition then? 🤔

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I'll try to make that in regex

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: only match 1 =, everything after first = is the password

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: yes, that's what it is doing right now

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: instead of "split on =, index 1 is the pw" that is flawed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ok, coolsies
